III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Last year, a youth observed a staff having sexual intercourse with
an unknown male who did not work or reside at the facility. Staff
was terminated, but then allowed back.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/13/24.
Staff 1 reported she no longer works at the facility but talks to staff
who work there still. Staff 1 reported they call her to share their
concerns because they tell Administrator 2/Licensee Designee
(LD) and nothing is getting done. Staff 1 reported she was told by
Staff 2 that Staff 3 was talking to Staff 5 about the situation she
was fired for, and Staff 2 overheard the conversation. Staff 1
reported in October 2022, a youth (couldn’t remember who) was
looking for a staff and found Staff 3 having sex with an unknown
man in the sensory room of the facility. Staff 1 reported
Administrator 2/LD fired Staff 3 after the incident, but 3-4 months
ago, Staff 3 was hired back.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/9/24 and face
to face at the facility in conjunction with MDHHS Worker on
2/13/24. Administrator 1 reported in the fall of 2022, she,
Administrator 2/LD and the previous Chief Administrator were
made aware of a situation where Youth A reported she saw Staff 3
and an unknown male watching a movie in the sensory room.
Administrator 1 reported Staff 3 was interviewed, denied she ever
had a male in the home, and refused to sign her termination letter.
Administrator 1 reported the facility didn’t have cameras at the
2

time, so it was a he-said/she-said situation. Administrator 1
reported a regular staff would not have been fired for the situation
based on the information they had. However, Staff 3 is
Administrator 1’s daughter, so she was held to a higher standard.
Administrator 1 reported Staff 3 was re-hired in August 2023,
which was a team decision made by Administrator 1,
Administrator 2/LD, Administrator 3, and the Previous Chief
Administrator. Administrator 1 reported Staff 3 was re-hired
because they needed additional staff at the facility, they never had
any proof the situation occurred, and Staff 3 continued to maintain
the reported situation never happened.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone by MDHHS worker on
2/9/24 and via phone by this Consultant on 2/14/24. Staff 2 told
MDHHS Worker there was a rumor Staff 3 had sex with a guy who
did not work for the facility while she was on shift. Staff 2 reported
it happened before she started working for the facility, and she
could not remember who told her the information. When
interviewed by this Consultant, Staff 2 reported Staff 5 told her
Staff 3 was bragging about how she got fired and was hired back.
Staff 2 reported she wasn’t working at the time the incident
allegedly occurred, so she couldn’t answer any other questions.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/13/24
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported in October
2022, she ordered food to be delivered to the home. When the
delivery guy came to drop off the food, she went into the sensory
room to get money for the delivery person to pay him and left him
standing in the doorway of the facility. When Staff 3 was in the
sensory room, Youth A woke up, came downstairs and came into
the sensory room with her. Staff 3 reported she walked out of the
sensory room, followed by Youth A, gave the delivery guy the
money, and walked Youth A back upstairs to her room. Staff 3
reported the delivery guy was never in the sensory room or in the
facility. Staff 3 reported she was terminated because the facility
had to err on the side of caution and listen to what Youth A said to
protect them. Staff 3 reported she never talked to Staff 2 or Staff 5
about the circumstances surrounding her being terminated or
rehired. Staff 3 reported it’s not something she wants to go around
boasting about because people will get the wrong impression.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at another facility on
2/15/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he
worked with Staff 3 when he first started working for another
facility associated with this facility. Staff 4 remembers Staff 3 was
fired but doesn’t know why she was fired. Staff 4 reported he
3

never worked at this facility, so he wouldn’t have any knowledge
of what occurred. Staff 4 reported he never told Staff 1 a youth
saw Staff 3 having sex with someone in the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 2/13/24 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported she was never told
anything regarding Staff 3’s employment history with the facility.
Staff 5 reported she has no knowledge of how long Staff 3 worked
at the facility, why she left, or how she came back. Staff 5 reported
she didn’t tell anyone any information about Staff 3 or her
employment history because she doesn’t have any information
about Staff 3.
Youth A was interviewed via video conference on 2/21/24 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she doesn’t
remember any staff’s names from the facility. Youth A does not
remember Staff 3. Youth A reported no one ever came into the
facility who didn’t work at the facility. Youth A reported she never
saw a male in the sensory room at the facility who didn’t work
there. Youth A reported she never saw a female staff member in
any room, including the sensory room, with a male who didn’t
work at the home. Youth A reported she never saw a female staff
member watching a movie or having sex with a male inside the
facility.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Staff 3’s employee file was reviewed. Staff 3 was
terminated on 10/17/22. Termination letter states “On
Saturday, October 15th, [Staff 3] worked the overnight shift
and had a male inside the Let’s Talk About It Home. This
male was not an employee of Let’s Talk About It and thus
not authorized to be on the premises.” Staff 3 signed
verification she read/reviewed the facility’s Code of Ethics
on 8/17/23.
• Note dated 10/16/22 authored by Administrator 1 was in
Staff 3’s employee file with her termination letter.
Administrator 1 reports a complaint was received from
[Staff 1] alleging a youth walked into the sensory room and
saw [Staff 3] and an unknown male having sex.
Administrator 1 met with each of the youth and asked them
if anything out of the ordinary happened during the
overnight shift, and they all responded no. Administrator 1
asked the youth if any of them got up and came downstairs
overnight, and all said no except [Youth A]. [Youth A] told
Administrator she woke up during the night and came
4

downstairs to get a drink of water when she saw [Staff 3] in
the sensory room watching a movie with a man.
• Note dated 10/16/22 authored by Administrator 2/LD was in
Staff 3’s employee file with her termination letter.
[Administrator 1] received the allegations about [Staff 3]
from [Staff 1], who reported she learned of the information
from [Staff 4]. Administrator 2/LD contacted [Staff 4] to ask
what he knew about the allegations. [Staff 4] stated he did
not know what [Staff 1] was talking about and did not know
anything about [Staff 3] having a male over at the house.
Administrator 2/LD spoke with [Staff 3] who stated she had
gotten hungry and ordered food to be delivered to her.
[Staff 3] reported she let the delivery person into the home
to drop off her food, but he did not stay. [Staff 3] denied she
had been in the sensory room with him. Administrator 2/LD
recommended termination based on the information
received.
• LTAI Code of Ethics (rev. 3/2023) outlines standards of
behavior and ethical judgments to be adhered to by staff. It
notes staff must utilize good judgment. Employees are to
maintain clear boundaries between their personal and
business interactions. Employees shall behave in a
manner that demonstrates dignity and respect to persons
served, staff members, visitors, volunteers & stakeholders.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is not established. There is no evidence Staff 3 had sex
with a male at the facility as no youth or staff saw this occur. The
facility proceeded with termination of Staff 3 in October 2022 to
hold her to a higher standard since she’s Administrator 1’s
daughter and to err on the side of caution as a safeguard for youth
served.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
